intro: Persicaria hastatotriloba, commonly known as the three-lobed smartweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes other species like buckwheat and sorrel. The plant features alternate, heart-shaped leaves with three distinct lobes, giving it its scientific name. It produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late summer. Persicaria hastatotriloba is often found in moist soils along stream banks and in wet meadows.
